definition: large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
(of a performer) to put on a show at an outdoor venue (temple fair, marketplace etc)/(fig.) to enhance sb's reputation/to make a name for oneself

sentences.english: There's nothing to do here; let's go into that field and knock a ball about for an hour or so.
sentences.chinese: 這裏無事可做，咱們去那個場子打一個來鐘頭的球吧。

sentences.english: He seems to be the most robust horse in the field.
sentences.chinese: 它可能是場子裏最健壯的馬。

sentences.english: I can book a court for this Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 我能在這個星期二安排好一個場子。

sentences.english: Before the formal performance, he flourished swords for a while to attract the audience.
sentences.chinese: 正式表演之前他先耍了幾趟刀，用來拉場子。

sentences.english: Cleans the place out, doesn't even lift a fucking finger.
sentences.chinese: 把場子清理出去，甚至不需要動他媽的一根手指。

sentences.english: Sports can really get me away from a stressful day and exercise my brain.
sentences.chinese: 我能在這個星期二安排好一個場子。

sentences.english: Cleans the place out, doesn't even lift af**king finger.
sentences.chinese: 把場子清理出去，甚至不需要動＊＊的一根手指。
